greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 3*(sqrt(25 + 10*sqrt(5))), the surface area of a regular dodecahedron with edges of unit length.
comment: Surface area of a regular dodecahedron: A = 3*(sqrt(25 + 10*sqrt(5)))* a^2, where 'a' is the edge.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10001
formula: Equals 15*phi/xi, where phi is the golden ratio (A001622) and xi its associate (A182007). (End)
xref: Cf. A102769, A001622 (phi), A182007 (associate of phi), A010527 (icosahedron/10), A010469 (octahedron), A002194 (tetrahedron). - _Stanislav Sykora_, Nov 30 2013
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Aug 30 2007
ext: More terms from _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 21 2011
